p: The SST analysis ( Fig 3) revealed that Pacific Ocean surface waters off Baja California, south of 30°N, have been warming during the last three decades (1987–2016, Fig 3d) at a rate that roughly doubles the rate of increase in global mean SST of 0.06°C decade -1 reported to have occurred since 1910 [ 44]. This recent strong warming trend is in sharp contrast to the cooling that occurred in that region throughout most of the 20th century ( Fig 3b and 3c). The first three decades of our study period (1897–1926) also had similar cooling trends.
